snippet: Forty-six percent of Americans said the Supreme Court’s decision to keep the health care law mostly in place was “a good thing,” and 41 percent said it was “a bad thing.” How the approval level compares with the approval of other historic...
lead_paragraph: Forty-six percent of Americans said the Supreme Court’s decision to keep the health care law mostly in place was “a good thing,” and 41 percent said it was “a bad thing.” How the approval level compares with the approval of other historic decisions shortly after they were issued.

headline.seo: Public Approval of Major Court Decisions
headline.main: Public Approval of Major Court Decisions

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
